meaning: The forensic tool failed to acquire, locate, or return all of the relevant information.
The tool reports something that is not actually present (false positive) or omits an item that is present (false negative about existence).
The tool alters data in a way that changes its meaning or context.
The tool groups unrelated items together or splits related ones, producing incorrect relationships.
The tool fails to detect or compensate for missing/corrupted data, or misreports corrupt segments as valid.
The examiner or downstream consumer misunderstands the results, or the tool’s presentation is misleading.
